required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Follow up Study of Patients Having Participated in Clinical Trial 64,185-204
clinical_study.official_title: A Four-Year Blinded Outcomes Follow-up Study of Patients Who Received Stannsoporfin or Placebo in Clinical Trial 64,185-204

lead_sponsor.agency: InfaCare Pharmaceuticals Corporation, a Mallinckrodt Company

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this follow up study are to evaluate the long-term effects of stannsoporfin (Stanate) on the health, growth, and development of patients who received a single dose of stannsoporfin with PT used to treat hyperbilirubinemia compared with patients in the control (placebo plus PT) group in clinical trial 64,185-204.

detailed_description.textblock:
Outcomes will be based on the following variables:
Reported AEs and SAEs Hearing assessments Developmental assessments

secondary_outcome.description: Conventional audiometry will be performed by a qualified specialist. Any findings from a failed conventional audiology examination will be recorded

The Mullen Scales of Early Learning examination has been selected for its standardized measurement of developmental skills in multiple domains (gross motor, visual reception, fine motor, expressive language, and receptive language). Testing will be done at visits 1 and 2 by a healthcare individual trained to administer the test. The Mullen raw scores, T-scores, and age equivalents will be recorded.

arm_group.description: Participants received placebo during the earlier study
Participants received Stannsoporfin 3.0 mg/kg during the earlier study
Participants received Stannsoporfin 4.5 mg/kg during the earlier study

intervention.description: Matching placebo administered by IM injection

study_pop.textblock: Patients who received a single dose of trial medication in clinical trial 64,185-204.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received IMP (stannsoporfin or placebo) in clinical trial 64,185-204
- Parents or guardians have given written informed consent to participate

overall_official.affiliation: InfaCare Pharmaceuticals Corporation, a Mallinckrodt Company
